text.div:
Implementation guide CH Core

CH_Core

The official URL for this implementation guide is:

http://fhir.ch/ig/ch-core/ImplementationGuide/CH-Core

resource.name: BFS Medizinische Statistik - 29 1.5.V04 - Behandlung nach Austritt / Prise en charge après la sortie / Trattamento dopo l’uscita
resource.description: BFS defines variables for medical statistic (german, french, italian) see [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.7066232.html). Behandlung, Pflege, Rehabilitation nach dem Spitalaufenthalt. Es geht darum, den Behandlungserfolg resp. den Abhängigkeitsgrad bei Austritt anzugeben. Nur die am besten zutreffende Kategorie auswählen.

resource.description: eCH-011 defines different Types like Names, contactAdress etc. They are further described from the [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/register/personenregister/registerharmonisierung/nomenklaturen.assetdetail.349276.html) in 'Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale' (Official catalogue of characteristics), Copyright BFS, Neuchâtel 2014, ISBN 978-3-303-00504-0

resource.name: Consent for Swiss EPR
resource.description: Example for a consent that Patient has a Swiss EPR

resource.name: Consent for Swiss EPR with Encounter exclusions
resource.description: Example for a consent that Patient has a Swiss EPR but exclude it for a specific encounter

resource.name: ahvn13-navs13
resource.description: The AHVN13 / NAVS13 - (abbreviation for new thirteen-digit Social Security number) - is an administrative identifier for natural persons in Switzerland. It is issued, announced and administered by the [Central Compensation Office](https://www.zas.admin.ch/zas/de/home/partenaires-et-institutions-/navs13.html). It is available to all organisations and communities for which there is a legal basis.

resource.name: ber
resource.description: The Business and Enterprise Register (BER) contains all enterprises and business in private and public law which are domiciled and exercise an economic activity in Switzerland.                       (in French, Registre des entreprises et des établissements (REE))                       (in German, Betriebs- und Unternehmensregister (BUR))                       (in Italian, Registro delle imprese e degli stabilimenti (RIS))

resource.name: epr-spid
resource.description: EPR-SPID: The Central Compensation Office (ZAS; CCO) assigns and manages the new patient identification number according to the EPRA (EPR-SPID), which is only linked internally in the CCO with the AHV number. It maintains the UPI identification database (Unique Personal Identifier Database), which the EPR communities may access. The law regulates how the the EPR-SPID can be used. SR 816.111 states (Art. 10 para. 3 EPDV) that communities must ensure that the EPR-SPID number cannot be not stored in document repositories or document registries.

resource.name: gln
resource.description: Each healthcare partner (natural or legal person) is referenced with a unique code of type GLN (former name: EAN code) of the [GS1](https://www.gs1.ch/de/home) system. See [refdata](https://www.refdata.ch/content/partner_d.aspx)

resource.name: uidb
resource.description: Unique IDentification Business (UIDB) number (in French, numéro d'IDentification suisse des Enterprises (IDE)) (in German, Schweizer Unternehmens-IDentifikationsnummer (UID)) (in Italian, numero d'IDentificazione svizzero delle Imprese (IDI))   Organizations Covered By System: All Companies/organizations registered in the public Swiss Registers such as the Swiss Register of Commerce, the Value Added Tax (VAT) register, the Social security agencies Registers, Cantons registers, etc., and publish in the UID Register.

resource.name: zsr
resource.description: The ZSR number is issued to self-employed, natural or legal persons (organisations) who can and want to work at the expense of health insurance. See [Sasis](https://www.sasis.ch/de/779)

resource.name: If an encounter is caused by an accident
resource.description: Extension to define an encounter that is caused by an accident and at which time the accident happened

resource.description: BFS Extension Admit Role for Encounter

resource.name: eCH-0007 municipalityId – BFS Gemeindenummer
resource.description: eCH-0007: Extension to define a BFS Number for a municipality

resource.name: Address line type
resource.description: eCH-0010: Extension to define line types for addresses

resource.name: FirstName
resource.description: eCH-0011: Extension to define first name type

resource.name: Name
resource.description: eCH-0011: Extension to define name type

resource.name: MaritalData - Separation Type
resource.description: eCH-0011: Extension to define the separation type. For married but separated persons and for persons in a registered partnership but living separately.

resource.name: Encounter, suspected readmission
resource.description: Encounter Extension for suspected readmission

resource.name: EPR Confidentiality Code
resource.description: Extension for the confidentiality code according to the Swiss EPR regulation

resource.name: EPR Data Enterer
resource.description: Extension to define the information about the person and organisation that entered data and the time of the data input, equivalent to the dataEnterer from a CDA document

resource.name: EPR Information Recipient
resource.description: Extension for a recipient of this document (corresponds to the addressee of a letter - person or organization), equivalent to CDA informationRecipient

resource.name: EPR Section ID
resource.description: Extension to define a section identifier. A CDA section has an optional identifier. With this extension the CDA section identifier can be added to the section of the FHIR composition.

resource.name: EPR Time
resource.description: CDA documents have the ability to add additional timestamps for the author or other elements. This extensions allows to add CDA timestamps to the respective FHIR elements.

resource.name: EPR Version Number
resource.description: A CDA document can have a versionNumber element. This element MUST contain the value 1 for the very first version of that document. For later versions, the version number MUST be increased by 1 each. With this extension the versionNumber can be specified for a FHIR Composition

resource.name: CH Core Composition Profile EPR
resource.description: Base definition for a composition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

resource.name: CH Core Composition Profile
resource.description: Base definition for a composition with the CH Core profiles.

resource.name: CH Core Coverage Profile
resource.description: The Coverage referenced in the CH Core profiles.

resource.name: CH Core Document Profile EPR
resource.description: Base definition for a document in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

resource.name: CH Core Document Profile
resource.description: Base definition for a document with the CH Core profiles.

resource.name: CH Core DocumentReference Profile EPR
resource.description: Base definition for a document reference in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

resource.name: CH Core DocumentReference Profile
resource.description: Base definition for a document reference with the CH Core profiles.

resource.name: CH Core Patient Profile EPR
resource.description: Core patient definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).                          It is used to include the patient in an EPR document (referenced in Composition/DocumentReference).

resource.name: CH Core Consent EPR Profile
resource.description: Base profile for a consent profile to document that a patient has an Electronic Patient Record (EPR) in Switzerland. The actual consent conditions are held within the EPR, this consent is the documentation in an organization that the patient has stated he has an EPR and this needs to be verified at the time of document publishing or reading. In addition a patient can reqeuest that specific information will not be published from the organization to the EPR. This can be documented with one or more references to encounters to exclude the consent for these.

resource.name: CH Core Patient Profile
resource.description: Core patient definition in the swiss context. Relevant are definitions by the eCH-0010 V7.0 data standard mailing address and eCH-0011 V8.1 data standard pesond data and CDA-CH V2 definitions. The CH Core Patient is based upon the core FHIR Patient Resource and designed to meet the applicable patient demographic data elements in Switzerland.  See also [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/register/personenregister/registerharmonisierung/nomenklaturen.html) for further information

resource.name: CH Core Encounter Profile
resource.description: The Encounter referenced in the CH Core profiles.

resource.name: Human Name
resource.description: Name with extensions for ech-11

resource.name: CH Core Location Profile
resource.description: Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Location resource for use with other CH Core resources

resource.name: CH Core Organization Profile EPR
resource.description: Core organization definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

resource.name: CH Core Organization Profile
resource.description: Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Organization resource for use with other CH Core resources

resource.name: CH Core Address Profile
resource.description: address incorporating eCH-0010 postal address extensions

resource.name: CH Core Postal Address Profile
resource.description: Postal address according to eCH-0010

resource.name: Address for place of Origin

resource.name: Address for place of Birth
resource.description: PlaceOfBirth for ech-11

resource.name: Place of birth according to eCH-0011

resource.name: Place of origin according to eCH-0011
resource.description: The place of origin of the patient.

resource.name: CH Core Practitioner Profile EPR
resource.description: Core practitioner definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

resource.description: Core practitioner definition in the swiss context.

resource.name: CH Core Practitioner Role Profile EPR

resource.name: ChCoreEncounterParticipationType
resource.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate how an individual participates in an encounter. In Switzerland the primary care physician is added to the extensible base ValueSet.

resource.name: ChCoreMaritalStatus
resource.description: MaritalStatus combined by fhir and eCH-11. See [maritalData - Zivilstandsangaben eCH-11](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html) and/or [BFS Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html).
